author: Alex Richards
title: Manchester United skipper Wayne Rooney contemplates his future and admits management hope
text:
Sport Manchester United skipper Wayne Rooney contemplates his future and admits management hope Rooney has been a professional footballer since the age of 16, but 15 years later is now thinking about when his playing days comes to an end Share Rooney says he's interested in a life on the bench after playing (Photo: Getty)     
Wayne Rooney has his eyes on management when he hangs up his boots. 
Manchester United and England’s all-time record goalscorer, now 31, is in the autumn of a career that began 15 years ago, when he broke onto the scene as a teenager at Everton. 
Now, the United captain is looking towards the future, and is contemplating what to do with himself when his playing days come to an end. 
And the man who has scored 250 goals for the Red Devils and won five Premier League titles, says he’d love the opportunity to lead his own side from the touchline. Rooney broke United's all-time goalscoring record last weekend (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) Rooney has spent the last 15 years in the Premier League (Photo: Reuters) 
"Of course, when you get a bit older you start to think a bit more about the game and it's something I'd like to do,” he told Football Focus . 
"My whole life has been around football and the minute I finish playing I'll try to stay in the game. Hopefully I'll get the opportunity to manage.” Rooney was only a substitute for United on Thursday night (Photo: Alex Livesey) Wayne Rooney poses with his recent Football Writers Association award (Photo: PA) 
Rooney has seen a number of his former teammates at club and international level - such as Jamie Carragher and Rio Ferdinand - carve out successful media careers. 
He has also seen others - such as Alan Stubbs and now Steven Gerrard - move into coaching, while Gary Neville has tried both. 
Much has been made of today’s players not needing the pressure of management from a financial point of view. And Rooney believes that success in management is quite simply a matter of desire. 
"Players playing in this generation have enough money to not have to go into management. The ones who want to do it will be successful." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
